summary: The Renewable Energy Certificate Study Act of 2025 directs the Comptroller General of the United States to conduct a study on Federal agency use of renewable energy certificates (RECs). The study will evaluate the impact of RECs on renewable energy investments, agencies' compliance with Executive Order 14057, and the cost-effectiveness of different compliance methods. The Comptroller General will submit a report to Congress detailing findings and recommendations for improving the REC market's impact on government renewable energy investments.
